title: LORE WRITER
body: Hi! i am a really good writer, and im creative, if you want to make a new champion design (probably cancer) you can comment here with your champions information and i will send a story back to you!

replies.body: I could use some help with the lore for my next concept. If I add you, can I run what I have past you?
I just saw this thread ... also, I might be able to help, I just started my two week break today (snow day!).
Okay. If you add me, I can give you what I've got so far, but I'm not putting what I've got up here. I've seen people get... concept-grabby.
Don't worry, I have too many ideas of my own that I need to figure out what the hell they're doing in my head first ...
Oh, I'd be more than willing to help you figure out stuff for your concepts! Always happy to help with stories!

Well, first I have to finish my crossover story ... and it HAS to be perfect.

No, I am not turning into Jhin ... why do people always think that...

Dw. Ppl in ow voice chat keep doing sexual jokes about me because they think I'm a hot girl... Idk why they even think that... Actually happened in lol last night too... And payday 2... And csgo... Fml

You'll see at some point this weekend.  ;)

My recommendation, **don't** read it before reading _Katarina's Legacy_ (my first fanfic) unless you want a **major** spoiler...
O...kay? I'll take your word for it. I'm just worried about shipping.
Write me a story about Flame! '^^

> [{quoted}](name=Kitty Katarina,realm=EUW,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=zE28q5Of,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2017-03-10T09:23:29.310+0000)
>
> Write me a story about Flame! '^^

.... if you want the lck player, i cant, i can only make fake storys
Dude ... Kitty means the character in his fanfic...

Say I'm interested in having someone write something for me (which I am, unfortunately, not). I'm not seeing a very good precedent for this "good writing" you promise, and so I leave the page.

If you have a story out there, I'd highly recommend linking it in the OP. That way, people get a good notion of what they're asking for. 

Just a friendly tip, writer to writer.
